title: Rivian posts mixed fourth quarter and underwhelming EV production outlook, stock falls
description: The results follow slower-than-expected production, unexpected pricing pressure and plans to lay off 6% of its workforce in a bid to conserve cash.

title: 10-year Treasury yield hits highest level since November
description: U.S. Treasury yields rose Tuesday, adding to their sharp February gains, as traders weigh the prospects of higher tighter monetary policy for longer.

title: Bitcoin, ether on track for a positive February despite mid-month drop and fading 2023 risk rally
description: Bitcoin and ether are on pace for a modest February win, even after suffering a big drop earlier in the month.

title: FTX ex-engineering chief Nishad Singh pleads guilty to criminal charges
description: FTX's former engineering head Nishad Singh pleaded guilty to criminal charges in New York on Tuesday

title: China's CCP warns Elon Musk against sharing Wuhan lab leak report
description: Chinese state media warned Tesla CEO Elon Musk that he could be endangering his relationship with China after Musk shared tweets about a Wuhan laboratory.

title: Goldman CEO says asset management is the new growth engine, will learn from bungled consumer effort
description: CEO David Solomon acknowledged that Goldman didn't "execute well" on its consumer push, but added that management would reflect and learn from the episode.

title: Chinese startup Realme launches $649 smartphone it says can be fully charged in just over 9 minutes
description: On Tuesday, Chinese smartphone upstart Realme launched the GT3 for international markets at the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.

title: Mexican president says Tesla will build a new plant in Mexico
description: Tesla will build a new plant in Monterrey, Mexico, and adhere to a series of commitments to address water scarcity

title: BP CEO defends spending plans as climate protesters block entrance to London energy conference
description: BP CEO Bernard Looney on Tuesday sought to defend the firm's fossil fuel spending plans as protesters disrupted the first day of a global energy conference.

title: Samsung says S23 smartphone sales ahead of S22 with most people buying the priciest 'Ultra' model
description: Sales of Samsung's Galaxy S23 flagship smartphone have outstripped last year's S22 in a comparative period, according Samsung executive Patrick Chomet.

title: Uber-backed ride hailing app Careem is halting its operations in Qatar
description: The surprise announcement, which went into effect immediately on Feb. 28, comes just months after Qatar hosted the 2022 World Cup.

title: As Russian forces bear down on Bakhmut, Ukraine admits situation there is 'more and more difficult'
description: Officials in Kyiv have conceded that the situation is rapidly deteriorating around Bakhmut, a besieged city in eastern Ukraine.

title: Brexit deal hailed as 'turning point' for Northern Ireland, but could still face opposition in Belfast
description: The new Brexit deal signed by the U.K. and the European Union on Monday was heralded as a "turning point" for Northern Ireland, but must still pass muster in Belfast.

title: Big Tech vs. Big Telco: Top EU official says there's no 'battle' over network funding
description: European Commissioner for the Internal Market Thierry Breton said there is not necessarily a "battle over fair share between Big Telco and Big Tech."

title: CNBC Daily Open: Stocks rebound from their worst week this year — but analysts aren't optimistic
description: Markets pulled back from their lows of last week and managed to stage a rebound. But they're still on track to end February in the red.

title: Credit Suisse 'seriously breached' obligations in Greensill case, Swiss regulator says
description: Credit Suisse "seriously breached its supervisory obligations" in the context of its business relationship with financier Lex Greensill and his companies, Swiss regulator FINMA concluded Tuesday.

title: British supermarkets are rationing fruit and vegetables as shortages bite
description: Poor weather conditions and higher energy costs have led to restrictions on popular salad items.

title: Motorola shows off a rollable smartphone with a screen that can extend vertically
description: The phone, which is being shown off at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, has a flexible five-inch display that extends to 6.5 inches when pushed upwards.

title: The U.S. and China have a culture clash around their telephone hotline
description: The politically important U.S.-China relationship is vulnerable to cultural differences — such as why a phone call doesn't get picked up.
